description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"dmefj","text":"The endoplasmic reticulum (ER) has a vast proteomic landscape to preform many diverse functions including protein and
lipid synthesis, calcium ion flux, and inter-organelle communication. The ER proteome is remodeled in part through membrane-embedded receptors linking ER to degradative autophagy machinery (selective ER-phagy). A refined tubular ER network is formed in neurons within highly polarized dendrites and axons. Autophagy-deficient neurons in vivodisplay axonal ER accumulation within synaptic ER boutons, and the ER-phagy receptor FAM134B has been genetically linked with human sensory and autonomic neuropathy. However, mechanisms and receptor selectivity underlying ER remodeling by autophagy in neurons is limited. Here, we combine a genetically tractable induced neuron (iNeuron) system for monitoring extensive
ER remodeling during differentiation. To verify iNeuron health in various knockout out cell lines, we fixed iNeuron cultures, performed a TUNEL (terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase dUTP nick end labeling) assay and stained with DAPI. We then imaged these via confocal fluorescence microscopy, and quantified intact, nonapoptotic nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":452,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qgjt","text":"

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Genetically modify Ngn2-inducible embryonic stem (ES) cell H9 line using Cas9
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"dm16u","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1kro","text":"Genetic editing of Ngn2-inducible ES cells is done using the following protocol
“Electroporation of Cas9 protein into human pluripotent stem cells” (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.br87m9zn)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":149,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"epald","text":"

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AEE43B137CD511EE9C1A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.br87m9zn"}}}}

steps.section: Differentiation of Stable Cell ES H9 line to induced neurons (iN)
Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1h7qu","text":"Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":63},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b63ov","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1fkg1","text":"To help get spread out iN for imaging, when iN get 90 percent confluent at any\npoint in the day 5-7 range, iN are plated into onto 35 mm-glass bottom dishes\n(No. 1.5, 14 mm glass diameter, MatTek) at a low confluency (approximately 1x105cells per 2mL dish).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":236,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"8nuo2","text":"At day 20, iN are fixed. phosphate buffered saline (1xPBS) with 8% paraformaldehyde is
prewarmed to 37C and then slowly added to an equal volume of media on the iN
for a resulting 4% paraformaldehyde solution. iN are incubated with this
solution at 37C for 15min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eb0fq","text":"Fixed iN are washed one time with room temperature 1xPBS\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"72mnp","text":"Fixed iN are solubilized with 0.1% triton-X in 1xPBS for 5 min at Room Temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b8j0v","text":"Fixed iN are then blocked for 30 min at RT with\nsterile filtered blocking buffer (1% bovine serum albumin, 0.1% triton-X in 1xPBS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"bc77e","text":"Fixed iN are then treated as directed in the Click-iT Plus TUNEL (terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase dUTP nick end labeling) assay (Invitrogen C10617, Alexa Fluor 488), which detects DNA breaks formed when DNA fragmentation occurs at the end of apoptosis.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dedb","text":"a.     Perform a TdT reaction. In this reaction, the TdT enzyme takes EdUTP (a dUTP modified with a small, bio-orthogonal alkyne moiety) and incorporates it at the 3’-OH ends of fragmented DNA. 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"380bb","text":"b.     Perform the click reaction (Breinbauer and Köhn, 2003; Wang et al., 2003; Rostovtsev et al.,
2002; Kolb et al., 2001), where a copper catalyzed covalent reaction occurs between the Alexa Fluor‱ picolyl azide dye and an alkyne. DNA break detection is based on Alexa Fluor signal at that site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":199,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A6FCA9487CD611EE9C1A0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ugen","text":"iN are washed 2 times with PBS (5min for each wash).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Induced neuron fixation, TUNEL assay, and DAPI nuclei staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bpqu7","text":"iN are incubated with 1xPBS containing DAPI (1:10,000) for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Imaging of DAPI nuclei and TUNEL stain via confocal microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"37hla","text":"iN are imaged at RT using a Yokogawa CSU-X1 spinning disk confocal on a Nikon Ti-E inverted microscope at the Nikon Imaging Center in Harvard Medical School. Nikon Perfect Focus System was used to maintain cell focus over time. The microscope is equipped with a Nikon Plan Apo 40x/1.30 N.A or 100x/1.40 N.A objective lens. 405nm (100mW) and 488nm (100mW) laser lines are controlled by AOTF.  All images are collected with a Hamamatsu ORCA-ER cooled CCD camera (6.45 µm2 photodiode) with Nikon Imaging Elements. Z-series image sets were acquired.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":468,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis and visual representation of nuclei and TUNEL stain via confocal microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4li8p","text":"Analysis and visual representation of nuclei and TUNEL stain via confocal microscopy\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":84},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":84}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis and visual representation of nuclei and TUNEL stain via confocal microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b0tnj","text":"Z series are displayed as maximum z-projections and saved using Fiji software.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis and visual representation of nuclei and TUNEL stain via confocal microscopy
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"47pcl","text":"Nuclei structures are detected using Cell Profiler with the same pipeline applied for each condition (see attached CellProfiler pipelines for specific thresholding details). 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sq4k","text":"a.    Analysis of cell nuclei using size. Cell profiler pipeline file to be used:  'WTvATG12vpentarintactnucleianalysis.cpproj'. The DAPI channel
images for all genetic backgrounds was thresholded in the same way with the following
pipeline: two different ‘identify primary objects’ modules were used to find and
count nuclei structures. In one, only larger “intact” nuclei were selected and
counted (as was done previously for the analysis of ER structures in axons to
get ER structures per nuclei). In the second, smaller fragmented nuclei were
included in the thresholding method. The ratio of intact to total DAPI-positive
nuclei structures was calculated and reported for each condition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":6,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jqtt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dlhq","text":"b.    Analysis of cell nuclei using TUNEL. Cell profiler pipeline file to be used:  'dapi_withtunel.cpproj'. The TUNEL channel images for all genetic backgrounds was thresholded in the same way using an ‘identify primary objects’ modules to find and count all damaged DNA structures.  For the corresponding DAPI channel images, two different ‘identify primary objects’ modules were used to find and count DAPI structures. In one, only larger “intact” DAPI-positive nuclei were selected. In
the second, smaller fragmented DAPI-positive nuclei were included in the thresholding method. To calculate a total nuclei number, the number of damaged TUNEL-positive DNA structures was added to the number of intact DAPI nuclei. In the final analysis, the ratio of intact DAPI-positive nuclei structures to total nuclei (damaged TUNEL positive nuclei plus intact) was calculated and
reported for each condition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":6,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis and visual representation of nuclei and TUNEL stain via confocal microscopy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1rmlt","text":"Each channel z series are brightness and contrast adjusted equally and then converted to RGB for publication using FIJI software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr3t6","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Analysis of nuclei integrity in cultured induced neurons by fluorescence microscopy
